channel.title: Make this code work?
channel.description:
Hello,
This is the code I am using to stop people from getting stuck on different high levels:
[code] if(command.startsWith("height")) { // what command the user types in if(heightLevel == 1) || (heightLevel == -1))) { // the high level the user needs to be on for the command to work heightLevel = 0; // ok, user is on correct high level, lets change the current high level customCommand("home"); // put user to "home" incase the heightlevel = 0 is somewhere unwalkable. } else { // if the user is not on that heightlevel sendMessage("It appears that you are not in need of this command!"); // the message they recieve } } [/code]
i get an error with this code, i want to make it so that it can have more than 1 height level, i guessed it would be like this
[code]if(heightLevel == 1) || (heightLevel == -1))) {[/code]
but i get errors.
any ideas.
Thanks

item.title: Make this code work?
item.dc:creator: @x_blitz_x x blitz x
item.description:
@x_blitz_x wrote:

if(command.startsWith("height")) { // what command the user types in
    if(heightLevel == 1 || heightLevel == -1) { // the high level the user needs to be on for the command to work
        heightLevel = 0; // ok, user is on correct high level, lets change the current high level
        customCommand("home"); // put user to "home" incase the heightlevel = 0 is somewhere unwalkable.
    } else { // if the user is not on that heightlevel
        sendMessage("It appears that you are not in need of this command!"); // the message they recieve
    }
}

Should work fine.

Read full topic

item.title: Make this code work?
item.dc:creator: @I_james_I I james I
item.description:
@I_james_I wrote:

Hello,

This is the code I am using to stop people from getting stuck on different high levels:

if(command.startsWith("height")) { // what command the user types in
if(heightLevel == 1) || (heightLevel == -1))) { // the high level the user needs to be on for the command to work
heightLevel = 0; // ok, user is on correct high level, lets change the current high level
customCommand("home"); // put user to "home" incase the heightlevel = 0 is somewhere unwalkable.
} else { // if the user is not on that heightlevel
sendMessage("It appears that you are not in need of this command!"); // the message they recieve
}
}

i get an error with this code, i want to make it so that it can have more than 1 height level, i guessed it would be like this

if(heightLevel == 1) || (heightLevel == -1))) {

but i get errors.

any ideas.

Thanks
